preprocessing_steps: Filter the dataset to include only houses where bedrooms >= 3
Count the number of houses in each furnishingstatus category
Sort the categories by count in descending order
rationale: A bar chart is the most appropriate for showing the distribution of furnishing status categories. It clearly compares the counts of each category, making it easy to understand the proportions of furnished, semi-furnished, and unfurnished houses with 3 or more bedrooms.

alternatives.rationale: This chart shows the same data but as percentages of the total, providing a clearer view of proportions.
preprocessing_steps: Filter the dataset to include only houses where bedrooms >= 3
Count the number of houses in each furnishingstatus category
Calculate the percentage of each furnishingstatus category relative to the total count
Sort the categories by percentage in descending order

alternatives.rationale: A pie chart can also show the distribution effectively, especially if the user wants a visual representation of the proportions. However, it may be less precise for exact counts.
